content.title: Financial Assistance For Development Of Buddhist/Tibetan Arts And Culture
content.details: The scheme 'Financial Assistance for Development of Buddhist/Tibetan Arts and Culture' was launched by the Ministry of Culture, Government of India to provide financial assistance to voluntary Buddhist/Tibetan organizations including Monasteries engaged in the propagation and scientific development of Buddhist/Tibetan culture, tradition and research in related fields.
benefits: Financial assistance up to ₹30.00 lakhs per year for any single organization.

Grants for maintenance, research projects, purchase of books, scholarships, special courses, audio-visual documentation, IT upgrades, transport facilities, and repairs/restoration of heritage buildings.
eligibility: Registered as a Society under the Societies Registration Act (XXI of 1860) or similar Acts.
Organizations mainly devoted to Buddhist/Tibetan studies and functioning for at least the last three years.
Organizations of regional or all-India character.
Not in receipt of grants from any other source for similar purposes.
exclusions: Organizations availing grants for civil works will not be eligible for the grant for similar purposes for the next ten years.
content.application_process: The organization shall submit a complete application along with all necessary documents through the concerned State Government/UTs. The application form may be downloaded from the Ministry of Culture website.
documents_required: Copy of the valid Registration Certificate.
Copies of Audited Accounts for the last three years.
Copies of the Annual Report for the last three years.
List of books to be purchased and their cost, if applicable.
Copy of registration certificate & other documents in proof of ownership of the land/building.
Detailed Project Report for civil works.
Details of teachers - name, age, qualifications and salary paid.
The proposal relating to the Award of Scholarship.

faqs.question: What is the objective of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The objective of the scheme is to give financial assistance to voluntary Buddhist/Tibetan organizations including Monasteries engaged in the propagation and scientific development of Buddhist/Tibetan culture, tradition, and research in related fields.

faqs.question: Which ministry has started the scheme?
faqs.answer: Ministry of Culture, Government of India.

faqs.question: Is this scheme centrally sponsored?
faqs.answer: Yes, this scheme is centrally sponsored.

faqs.question: How much financial assistance will be provided under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Financial assistance is given up to a maximum of ₹30.00 lakhs per year for any single organization.

faqs.question: Which organization will be given preference for providing funds?
faqs.answer: Organizations doing good work in the field and having resources for meeting matching funds will be given preference.
